history.content: If staying for an extra semester just to take more classes, then it's not worth it since most of software engineering skills can only be learnt on the job. You can just replace one of data 100 and cs 188 with cs 189, and you have already taken most of the best cs classes here 162 + 170 + 189 + 161. If you want to stay an extra semester to have fun, then go for it !

children.subject:
it kind of depends on your interests. personally, I'd still have some classes remaining on my want-to-take list. on the cs side that'd be 189, 152 and 184 and on the ee side 126, 127, 120 and 106a (tho this is only in fall). also could be fun to explore some math classes like 104, 110, 113.

that said, not really necessary for swe if that's your main question.

history.content:
I'm finishing my Junior year and I need only two more upper div classes to graduate. I'm wondering whether I should graduate a semester early to save money and possibly start working as a SWE in the spring.

A very brief description of my coursework at Berkeley:
- ChemE major for my freshman year and realized it wasn't for me :( Switched to CS

- CS upper divs I took (or am taking): 162, 170, and 186

- Planning on taking Data 100, 161, and 188 in Fall 2021.

If I graduate early, I will have spent only 5 semesters doing CS. How are you all spending your time here? Are there any classes or experiences that I'm missing out on that are worth the extra semester's tuition? Are there benefits career-wise for staying? Looking forward to hearing your perspectives!
history.subject: Pros/Cons of graduating a semester early
